It disconnects itself from the network and constantly needs TLC.  It's very slow to operate and keep connected to network.  Use the $35 wisely and invest toward a Roku.
author: Chris French

review: Right out of the the box this works great. Setup takes seconds, all you have to to do is plug it into power and your tv and use the app from your phone or tablet. It will take the network info from your device and ask what would you like to name it and your done. Any supported app will see it on the network and show a cast button in the app or you can install a Chrome extension and cast web pages (flash of java plugins do not work). Now with SDKs are out there are a lot of different kind apps available. Most of them are video services (YouTube, Netflix, Hulu, etc), music (Google Play Music, Songza, etc) and I have seen a lot of games now too.Only a few downsides and most come from Google's own YouTube support. You can have multiple people connected but if someone connects during a casting video while having a video open on their device it will clear the playlist and stop the playing video. Also you can't have a computer and mobile device connected at the same time, the later one to connect will override what it casting. Once I trained a few people on these issues we didn't have them occur again but shouldn't be necessary.
